data.title: Martin Lawrence will bring all-star comedy show to Bankers Life Fieldhouse
data.meta_description: Stand-up lineup at Bankers Life Fieldhouse includes Martin Lawrence, Deray Davis and Bruce Bruce
data.text:
Martin Lawrence and four other stand-up comedians will share a bill next year in Indianapolis.

The "Lit AF" tour includes a Feb. 23 date at Bankers Life Fieldhouse.

In addition to Lawrence, who starred in TV sitcom "Martin" from 1992 to 1997, the show will feature Deray Davis, Bruce Bruce, B. Simone and Tommy Davidson.

Tickets go on sale at noon Friday, Nov. 22. For more information, visit ticketmaster.com.

Lawrence brought his "Lit AF" touring concept that spotlights different acts from city to city to Indiana Farmers Coliseum in 2016.

At Bankers Life Fieldhouse, attendees will see:

Deray Davis, known for his 2017 Netflix stand-up special "How to Act Black."

Bruce Bruce, a former host of BET's "ComicView."

B. Simone, a cast member of VH1 reality series "Girls Cruise."

Tommy Davidson, an "In Living Color" cast member across all five seasons of the Fox network show.

Lawrence and Will Smith co-star in film "Bad Boys for Life," which arrives Jan. 17 in theaters.
